sentences.text: 2016 Say-on-Pay Vote and Stockholder Outreach
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 91% vote in favor of our say-on-pay proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 annual meeting, our stockholders approved our 2015 executive compensation, with 91% of the voting interests in favor of our proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outreach to more than 75% of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe it is important to communicate regularly with our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to our day-to-day interactions regarding our financial and operating performance, we enhanced our engagement program to reach out to our stockholders about our governance and compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of 2016, we and the Board reached out to stockholders representing more than 75% of our outstanding shares of common stock to update them and solicit feedback on recent governance and compensation program improvements and company performance to date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, we hosted a major investor forum open to all of our current and prospective investors at which our CEO and executive team provided our 2017 long-term outlook and answered questions about our financial and operational performance, governance and compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Throughout 2016, our top stockholders had direct and regular access to our CEO and executive team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of our executive team had more than 400 in-person meetings with our investors in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We understand from our stockholders that this direct and regular access to our executive team is appreciated and not common for all companies of our size and stature.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Focus on the stockholder continues to be our guiding principle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes to our proxy statement revolved around creating a document that would be more useful to our stockholders and foster a greater understanding of our company and its compensation and governance programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response to stockholder feedback, we made the following changes to our compensation and governance programs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We adopted proxy access with a 3/3/20/20 market standard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This standard generally requires ownership of 3% of our common stock by up to 20 stockholders for at least three years to nominate up to the greater of 20% or two of our directors to be eligible for proxy access rights under our bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We brought additional rigor to our outperformance plan to make it more difficult to achieve payouts under the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also added a lockup to restrict the sale of all equity received under POP for three years after the end of the applicable three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This equity lockup keeps executives further aligned with our stockholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discussion of Compensation Comparison Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes we should compensate our NEOs competitively and reasonably.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee sets a competitive reference point for the elements of target total core compensation (annual base salary, annual bonus and annual LTI equity awards) at the market median of a comparison group of large-cap REITs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target compensation is positioned within a reasonable range of the competitive reference point based on the NEOs level of experience, past performance and anticipated future contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No REITs represent a true comparison to Prologis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, FW Cook, our independent compensation consultant, conducted its annual competitive analysis of target compensation levels for our NEOs on behalf of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The comparison group used by FW Cook comprised 10 large-cap REITs that are generally the largest internally managed U.S. publicly traded equity REITs by market capitalization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FW Cook used size and scope of operations to determine which companies would accurately gauge competitive pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the following REITs were among the closest in comparison to us, the combination of our worldwide reach, significant development platform, and size and scope of our strategic capital business put us in a unique category.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such companies may individually demonstrate strength in one or two of these categories, but not in all.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The comparison group did not include any industrial REITs because they were too small relative to us
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Elements and 2016 Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation components provide incentives to achieve strong TSR and operating performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program is structured into three main components: annual base salary, annual bonus and LTI awards (annual LTI equity awards and outperformance incentives).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each component plays a specific role in supporting our business model to achieve long-term value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How Components of Our Compensation Program Fit Together
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target Core Compensation Targeted at Median Outperformance Compensation at High-Reach Hurdles Annual Base Salary Annual Bonus Opportunity Long-term Incentive Awards Annual LTI Equity Awards Outperformance Compensation Plan Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although no other REITs compare directly to us, target core compensation is aimed at market median of our comparison group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed above, we have larger scope and reach than most of the REITs in our comparison group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonetheless, target compensation from core compensation elements (annual base salary, annual bonus and annual LTI equity awards) is targeted within a reasonable range of the market median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Together, annual LTI equity and outperformance opportunities result in aggregate long-term compensation that aligns with company performance levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual LTI equity formula was set such that target awards will be earned if our performance is at market levels (i.e., equal to the weighted average return of three market indices).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outperformance opportunities are set at strenuous thresholds to drive exceptional performance beyond market levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we perform at market levels, our NEOs will receive LTI compensation at target (and consistent with market medians).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if we outperform the strenuous hurdles in the outperformance plans, NEOs will receive total LTI compensation that reflects the level of outperformance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The outperformance compensation plans are additional long-term incentive opportunities commensurate with the size and scope of our business, but they only go into effect when outperformance levels are reached.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For further detail, please see Outperformance compensation plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual base salary for 2016 performance year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No increases were made to annual base salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on FW Cooks competitive analysis discussed above, the Compensation Committee determined that our NEOs base salaries continue to be competitive and held our CEOs base salary at $1 million and our other NEOs base salaries at $600,000 for the 2016 performance year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual bonus for 2016 performance year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual bonus rewards successful execution of our strategic priorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee establishes annual bonus metrics based on our performance against our strategic priorities, which are weighted according to their significance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This practice aligns bonuses with the successful execution of our business plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 bonuses were largely determined by our performance along cornerstone operational metrics (weighted at 40% of all metrics reviewed): Core FFO per share, average occupancy, same store net operating income (SSNOI) growth and rent change on rollovers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These metrics are important to our stockholders in assessing the health and performance of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Key Annual Bonus Metrics Target Actual Core FFO per share(1) $2.42 $2.57 Average Occupancy 95.7% 96.2% SSNOI Growth(1) 3.3% 4.4% Rent Change on Rollovers(2) 10.5% 13.8%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overall Corporate Score: Above target
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the Compensation Committee weights portfolio operational metrics significantly higher than any other bonus metric category (40% vs. 10%-15%), our 2016 overall bonus score is largely driven by portfolio operational results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our operational results were significantly above target, delivering some of our strongest results on record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We achieved our highest Core FFO per share, average occupancy, rent change on rollovers and SSNOI growth since our 2011 Merger, well ahead of our targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to significant above-target performance on our operational bonus metrics, as well as strong performance on most other bonus metrics (as discussed below), the Compensation Committee determined that our overall corporate bonus score was above target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Core FFO per share and SSNOI are non-GAAP measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Appendix A for definitions and discussions of non-GAAP measurements and reconciliations to the most directly comparable GAAP measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target Core FFO per share is calculated with a constant level of promotes to isolate changes in our core operational performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual Core FFO calculated with the same constant level of promotes is $2.48 per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Average Occupancy, SSNOI Growth and Rent Change on Rollovers are based on our owned and managed portfolio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bonus metrics are rigorous and difficult to achieve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its analysis of the performance required to execute our strategic priorities, the Compensation Committee set the targets for the 2016 performance year to be rigorous, requiring substantial effort to achieve the targets in the context of the overall business plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most of the targets for the 2016 performance year required improvement of the applicable metrics over the 2015 targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 Core FFO per share bonus metric of $2.42 increased by 18% over our 2015 Core FFO per share target of $2.05(1).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 average occupancy and rent change on rollover metrics increased by 70 basis points and 100 basis points, respectively, over the 2015 bonus metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Compensation Committee analyzes our same store pool of operating properties to determine the level of SSNOI growth that is appropriate to earn target bonus levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 target SSNOI growth metric was 3.3% versus our 2015 target SSNOI growth metric of 3.8%(1).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since the composition of the same store pool of properties changes each year, SSNOI growth is indicative of growth in the portfolio throughout the year but may not necessarily increase year over year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Significantly above-target operational performance results in a corporate bonus score above target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that our overall corporate bonus score was above target, mostly due to the above-target performance of our operational bonus metrics, which are the most significant bonus metrics by weight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to evaluating operational metrics, the Compensation Committee also assesses metrics related to land, deployment, strategic capital, balance sheet and risk reduction and back office/organizational matters, weighted at 10% to 15% each and set at difficult levels to incentivize performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee determined that these other metrics in aggregate were above target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining our corporate bonus score, the committee considered the following accomplishments as well as notable contributions by the NEOs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overall
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the leadership of Mr. Moghadam, the executive team led the company in record-breaking operating performance and achievement of our goals mostly substantially above target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We delivered record period-end occupancy and substantial rental growth and development value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are now positioned to take advantage of growth opportunities throughout the economic cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Portfolio Operations (Weighted at 40%)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our company-wide operational results in 2016 were strong as discussed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Reilly delivered outstanding results for the Americas, exceeding all targets for occupancy, rent change on rollovers and SSNOI growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Anderson contributed strong operational performance in Europe, at or ahead of targets for all key metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also delivered strong SSNOI growth in Asia, as well as significant average occupancy in Japan and rent change on rollovers in China, all ahead of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Nekritz led his team in negotiations and execution of over 2,500 lease transactions and over $3.5 billion in other real estate transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Land (Weighted at 10%)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our monetization of land reduced our land bank to $1.4 billion according to plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notably, Mr. Curless continued to elevate company focus on land sales and executed dispositions that reduced the land bank by approximately $145 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deployment (Weighted at 15%)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The profitability of our development business was very strong.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We stabilized $2.5 billion of development projects at a 25.5% margin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Curless led the build-to-suit development program resulting in 36 development starts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, he oversaw the completion of over $1.5 billion in building dispositions in 63 transactions in the United States Mr. Anderson delivered strong stabilization activity in Europe and stabilizations and contributions in Japan that exceeded our plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strategic Capital (Weighted at 10%)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our strategic capital ventures had a strong year of operating performance and fee growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strategic capital fees/AUM increased to 53 basis points.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our European ventures had a particularly good year with strong performance and net asset value growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Anderson and Mr. Nekritz led our China fund extension, its $750 million equity raise and the merger between two of our European ventures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Nekritz also oversaw 21 equity investment transactions in our open-end vehicles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Japan, Mr. Anderson and Mr. Olinger launched a successful equity raise for our publicly traded Japanese REIT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Balance Sheet and Risk Reduction (Weighted at 15%)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our balance sheet has become one of the strongest in our industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the leadership of Mr. Olinger, we took our loan-to-value ratio(1) to 34.6% and our debt/adjusted EBITDA(1) ratio to 5.5x at year-end, substantially exceeding our target goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, under the stewardship of Mr. Olinger, we achieved an upgrade to our credit ratings from Moodys and S&P of A3 and A-, respectively, defying expectations that our goal to achieve an A- credit rating would be delayed due to our capitalization plan to fund the strategic KTR-owned portfolio acquisition in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back Office/Organization (Weighted at 10%)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By increasing efficiency across the organization through process improvement and leveraging our global systems and platform, we reduced general & administrative (G&A) expenses as a percentage of AUM to 52 basis points.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking advantage of our scale as a competitive advantage, we enhanced our business intelligence capabilities and led the industry curve on research, publishing thought pieces around e-commerce, rent growth and supply.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our entire executive team was keenly focused on reducing G&A company-wide.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Reilly drove G&A/AUM down in his region, leveraging scale and managing significant growth without an overall increase in overhead.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Anderson championed the adoption of real estate forecasting and information management tools designed to enhance efficiency, while Mr. Olinger and Mr. Nekritz led the company initiative to manage corporate overhead.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Core FFO per share, SSNOI, our loan-to-value ratio and debt/adjusted EBITDA are non-GAAP measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Appendix A for definitions and discussion of non-GAAP measurements and reconciliations to the most directly comparable GAAP measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our loan-to-value ratio excludes development gains.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bonus exchange programfurther aligns NEOs with stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our bonus exchange program, generally all of our employees may elect to receive all or a portion of their cash bonus in equity of the company, serving to further align our interests with our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain employees, including the NEOs, may elect to receive their bonus exchange equity either in the form of restricted stock units (the RSUs) of the company or LTIP units of Prologis, L.P. (the LTIP Units).

sentences.text: Annual LTI equity awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our LTI equity award determination is formulaic and aligned with performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response to stockholder feedback, starting with the 2016 grants based on 2013-2015 performance, the Compensation Committee incorporated an equity award formula in our compensation program to provide greater transparency in how we determine the size of our equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee structured the equity award formula to foster greater objectivity and more clearly define the methodology it uses to determine awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The equity formula did not change the committees approach from prior years but was adopted to formally evidence the committees methodology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The formula does not guarantee minimum compensation or make the program less performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee back-tested the equity formula, which revealed results consistent with previous awards and our longstanding compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Multiple benchmarks are required given our unique business model.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use two industrial REIT comparison groups (one domestic and one global) to compare against companies operating in our same asset class.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the companies in these comparison groups are much smaller than we are.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, we also use a large-cap REIT index, the Cohen & Steers REIT Index, as discussed below, to compare our performance against similarly sized companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee selected these indices because they are a balanced representation of investment alternatives for our stockholders (i.e., other industrial REITs and other large-cap REITs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As previously discussed, even among large-cap REITs, none has the same overall worldwide reach, substantial development business and size and scope of strategic capital business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Very few industrial REITs and even fewer global industrial REITs exist.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our industrial REIT comparison groups include only seven companies in total.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Weightings between the domestic and global industrial REIT comparison groups generally reflect the relative breakdown between our global and domestic AUM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Cohen & Steers REIT Index as an additional benchmark mitigates volatility of the small comparison group of industrial REITs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Cohen & Steers REIT Index includes approximately 30 well-capitalized REITs, mitigating volatility of our smaller industrial REIT comparison groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes it should use a measure important to our stockholders to evaluate our performance against other large-cap REITs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To compensate for the limitations of the industrial REIT comparison groups and stabilize the overall benchmark, the Compensation Committee included the Cohen & Steers REIT Index and weighted it at 50%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The larger Cohen & Steers REIT Index mitigates any aberrations and wide variances and is a better reflection of the steady performance of large-cap companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee intended for 50% of target LTI equity awards to be tied directly to the relative TSR performance formula and the other 50% to be awarded based on a qualitative assessment of performance and to promote retention and alignment with our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This mix between relative TSR and qualitative performance is consistent with the average mix of our comparison group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The qualitative component is conditioned on individual and company performance in line with threshold levels of market compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No minimum equity grant value is guaranteed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Equity Incentives = Formulaic Approach.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The equity award formula establishes that up to 50% of the target annual LTI equity grant value will be a qualitative portion of the award conditioned on market threshold levels of performance and is not guaranteed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the formula, any amounts awarded above 50% of target will be determined by our three-year annualized TSR performance against a weighted index of a combination of the Cohen & Steers REIT Index and comparison groups of domestic and global industrial REITs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual LTI equity award amounts are determined using the linear payout scale set forth below (with interpolation between levels).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual LTI Equity Award Formula
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity amounts above 50% of target are based on Prologis three-year TSR vs. index three-year TSR weighted as follows: Cohen & Steers REIT Index TSR (weighted 50%) + Industrial REIT Group TSR (weighted 50%)   Domestic Industrial REITs (weighted 80%) Global Industrial REITs (weighted 20%) Prologis Three-Year TSR Basis Points Above/Below Weighted Index TSR Total Annual LTI Equity Award as % of Target Value +500 bps and above 150% +400 bps 140% +300 bps 130% +200 bps 120% +100 bps 110% 0 100% -100 bps 90% -200 bps 80% -300 bps 70% -400 bps 60% -500 bps and below Up to 50% conditioned on market threshold levels of performance and is not guaranteed
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual equity award program does not guarantee a minimum level of compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with prior years, the revised program design anticipates that total annual LTI equity awards would continue to be earned in a range of 50% to 150% of overall target levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the revised program, the size of the annual equity awards within this range was determined based on relative TSR performance against the same indices used in the current program with the intent that the bottom end of the range (i.e., 50% of target) would be granted if warranted by individual and company performance commensurate with threshold levels of market compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bottom end of the range is a qualitative component that is not tied to the relative TSR measurement against the various indices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This qualitative component continues to be conditioned on individual and company performance in line with threshold levels of market compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We did not in prior years, and currently do not, guarantee any minimum level of annual equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The qualitative component currently can range (and could have ranged in the past) between 0% and 50% of target, depending on performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reserves the right to award less than 50% of target, or to grant no equity to an executive, if warranted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The equity formula did not change the performance-based nature of our annual equity award program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee will continuously reevaluate the equity formula to ensure that it properly reflects the committees assessment of market compensation and the levels of performance that warrant market compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The required performance levels have not diminished and remain unchanged from previous years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outperformance compensation plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outperformance compensation opportunities complete our pay package.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual LTI equity is part of core compensation targeted at the market median to ensure competitive compensation opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outperformance compensation plans complete the total pay opportunity for our NEOs when exceptional levels of performance are reached.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance indices used in our outperformance plans assess our operational and TSR outperformance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual LTI equity and POP program use the four TSR indices important to our stockholders in determining our relative performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PPP uses return metrics based on the promote hurdles as a gauge of operational success of our strategic capital ventures, which represent a significant portion of the assets we own and manage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our outperformance plans extend beyond the NEOs to about 100 participants in total, distributing the compensation pools more broadly beyond the NEOs than most other outperformance plans we reviewed at the inception of the outperformance plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prologis Outperformance Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POP uses rigorous TSR hurdles to promote superior long-term value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We created POP to promote long-term relative TSR outperformance as measured against the MSCI REIT Index, an index often used by our stockholders to assess our relative performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POP plan hurdles are high-reach and formulaic.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee intended that the performance hurdles under POP would be so difficult to exceed that it is unlikely to pay out regularly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The POP compensation pool only funds if and to the extent our three-year compound annualized TSR exceeds the three-year compound annualized TSR of the MSCI REIT Index by 100 basis points.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monte Carlo statistical simulations show no payout in 65% of the scenarios modeled.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fact, POP awards did not pay out for the first two performance cycles (2012-2014 and 2013-2015) under the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our POP award payouts are a fraction of the value created for our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POP awards are a small percentage of the overall value created for our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we simply achieve the index TSR, no POP compensation pool will fund.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we exceed the threshold of 100 basis points above the index, only 3% of our outperformance above the hurdle (subject to a cap) funds the POP compensation pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We exceeded the performance hurdle for the 2014-2016 performance period, which resulted in an aggregate performance pool paid to 80 participants that is 2.2% of the $2.8 billion in value created for our stockholders above index performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Calculated in accordance with POP, our three-year annualized TSR was 16.0% at year-end 2016, while that of the MSCI REIT Index was 12.6%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional absolute TSR performance hurdle and award cap are safety measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POP awards cannot be paid at a time when our absolute TSR is negative
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a pool funds because our relative TSR outperforms the index and exceeds the hurdle, but our absolute three-year TSR is not positive, then the awards will not be paid unless and until absolute TSR becomes positive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The award will expire seven years after the end of the performance period if absolute TSR does not become positive within that period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The POP compensation pool for each performance cycle is capped at the maximum of the greater of $75 million and 0.5% of our equity market capitalization at the start of a performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We amended POP in 2016 to make it more difficult to earn the compensation pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response to stockholder feedback, we added additional rigor to POP to make it more challenging to earn the compensation pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We increased the difficulty of the existing performance hurdle under POP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Not only does our three-year compound annualized TSR need to exceed the MSCI REIT Index by 100 basis points, but we are now required to meet or exceed the TSR of the MSCI REIT Index for an additional 3 years after the initial three-year performance period to earn any amounts above $75 million in aggregate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also added a holding requirement on all equity awarded under POP until the third year after the end of the applicable three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prologis Promote Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PPP uses rigorous investment return hurdles to encourage superior long-term value creation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We created PPP to encourage long-term operational outperformance in our strategic capital ventures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance of our ventures not only reflects the performance of a significant portion of the assets we own and manage but also translates into value created for our stockholders and venture investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Promote hurdles are formulaic and difficult to achieve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strategic capital incentive fees (or promotes) are earned by the company when returns in certain of our strategic capital ventures exceed pre-negotiated preferred return hurdles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These promotes are third-party validated measures of operational success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a number of our ventures, meeting a promote hurdle requires an internal rate of return in excess of an 8% to 10% annualized return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Promotes are often structured such that the company receives 15% to 20% of returns above the return hurdles until it receives a negotiated internal rate of return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To meet or surpass the promote hurdles, we must make smart capital allocation decisions and manage our assets to produce outstanding returns over an extended period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achievement of promote hurdles means that we have created greater net asset value overall in the applicable venture and superior returns for our venture investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This also translates into tremendous value created for our stockholders increasing the value of our ownership share of the ventures as well as driving earnings from promote and management fee payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When we achieve the difficult promote hurdle and the company earns the promote, the promote proceeds are used to fund a PPP compensation pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This pool is 40% of the promote (after excluding our ownership share in the applicable venture) typically paid to about 100 participants in total.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PPP awards are subject to a cap.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual awards under PPP are capped at the participants compensation (excluding awards under the two outperformance compensation plans) for the two most recently completed years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our PPP plan award payouts are a fraction of the value created for our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we continue our strong operating performance, we anticipate that we will continue to earn promotes and create value that will result in awards under PPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We exceeded promote hurdles and received promotes from three of our ventures, resulting in a payment of awards under PPP in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PPP awards are a small percentage of returns in excess of the superior value created by hitting the hurdles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PPP awards paid in 2016 to about 100 participants were in aggregate only 2.6% of the $866.4 million in stockholder value created in achieving the hurdles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTIP Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTIP Units are profits interests in Prologis, L.P., our operating partnership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain executives, including NEOs, may elect to receive LTIP Units in lieu of RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs elected to receive all of their equity awards granted in 2016 in LTIP Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTIP Units were structured to be generally economically equivalent to RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTIP Units generally have the same three-year vesting terms as RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO waiver of retirement eligibility benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For any equity awards granted starting in 2017, Mr. Moghadam waived any vesting benefits related to meeting retirement-eligibility thresholds under our incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting under such awards will continue after he terminates employment as long as he continues in a substantial role with the company or its affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Had Mr. Moghadam not waived such provisions, he would be entitled to certain benefits such as the acceleration of vesting of his equity awards upon termination of his employment after he meets the retirement-eligibility thresholds under our compensation plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation Elements and Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior-level benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to benefits provided to all other U.S. employees, such as our 401(k) plan, health care and welfare coverage, paid time-off, life and accident insurance and short and long-term disability programs, we offer our NEOs the following senior-level and change-in-control benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred compensation plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retiree medical benefitsupon retirement after age 40 and having served as a member of the management executive committee (our CEO and certain direct reports) for five consecutive years, executives may continue health coverage under our plans at their own expense
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial planning services
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company-paid parking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Personal use of leased corporate aircraft interest by our CEO if reimbursed by CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change-in-control benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fair and reasonable severance in connection with a change in control to serve the best interests of stockholders during a threatened or actual change in control by:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Providing for continuity of management teams services, as well as providing for their best efforts over any transition period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increasing objectivity of management team in analyzing a proposed change in control and advising the Board if such proposal is in the best interests of stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits apply on a double-trigger basis (change in control has occurred and NEOs employment status is impacted) and consist of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash severance payments that are a multiple of salary and/or cash bonus opportunity levels (two times salary and bonus for NEOs)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accelerated vesting of unvested equity awards, available through change-in-control agreements or long-term equity incentive plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Governance Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do Pay aligns with performance: performance measures heavily weighted to three-year relative TSR Most pay is at-risk and not guaranteed Robust stock ownership requirements: CEO: 10x salary Other NEOs: 3x salary Clawback policy for NEOs Double-trigger change-in-control provisions Independent compensation consultant Annual compensation risk-related review Minimal perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Dont Do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No guaranteed salary / bonus increases
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No employment agreements for NEOs guaranteeing compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No repricing or buyouts of stock options without stockholder approval
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No excise tax gross-ups
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No hedging or pledging of our common stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk mitigation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee conducts annual risk assessment of compensation programs: The Compensation Committee monitors the risk profile with respect to compensation policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No material risks were found.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Quarterly reports to Board on company performance against business plan and strategic objectives: The Board provides oversight to ensure that our compensation structure is not driving the company to take excessive operational risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internal management controls: Controls and procedures ensure operations are completed in line with governance standards to ensure that excessive risks are not taken, including a series of checks and balances with respect to commitment of capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Real estate risk management: Real estate risk management processes monitor key risks associated with our real estate assets, such as levels of occupancy, non-income-producing assets, leverage, foreign currency exposure and other factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recoupment policy: This policy is a mechanism to claw back compensation in the event of a financial restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership guidelines: These guidelines align management interests with stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All NEOs and directors are in compliance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidelines require stock ownership of at least a multiple of annual base salary for officers (10x base salary for CEO; 3x base salary for other NEOs; and 1x base salary for senior vice presidents, managing directors and regional presidents).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock eligible under the guidelines includes common stock, vested, unvested and deferred equity awards (except stock options), associated dividend equivalents, earned LTIP Units and partnership units exchangeable into our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidelines require retention of 50% of net shares received under our equity plans upon certain events until guidelines are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hedging and pledging policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All hedging and pledging of common stock is prohibited: Our insider trading policy prohibits all NEOs, employees and directors from hedging or pledging shares of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our NEOs and directors are currently in compliance with this prohibition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation recoupment (Clawback) policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted a compensation clawback policy, which provides that in the event of a substantial restatement of our previously issued financial statements, a review will be undertaken by the Board of performance-based compensation awarded to certain officers that was attributable to our financial performance during the time periods restated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Board determines that an officer was improperly compensated and that it is in our best interests to recover or cancel such compensation, the Board will pursue all reasonable legal remedies to recover or cancel such performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy further provides that if the Board learns of any misconduct by certain officers that caused the restatement, the Board shall take such action as it deems necessary to remedy the misconduct, prevent its recurrence and, if appropriate, based on all relevant facts and circumstances, punish the wrongdoer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such punishment by the Board could include dismissal, legal action for breach of fiduciary duty or such other action to enforce the officers obligations to us as may fit the facts surrounding the particular case.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the appropriate punishment, the Board may take into account punishments imposed by third parties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards power to determine the appropriate punishment for the wrongdoer is in addition to, and not in replacement of, remedies imposed by such third parties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity grant policy and program administration
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards are administered by our human resources and stock plan administration departments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grants are made generally in the first quarter of the year, after promotion, at the time of new hire or in accordance with PPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity grant dates are not scheduled based on the timing of the release of material non-public information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We discontinued the issuance of stock option awards after February 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Impact of accounting and tax treatment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent reasonable, all executive compensation will be deductible by the company for federal income tax purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee may design compensation program components that are not deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because we intend to qualify as a REIT under the Internal Revenue Code, we generally distribute 100% of our net taxable income each year and therefore, do not pay U.S. federal income tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the possible loss of a federal tax deduction would not be expected to have a material impact on us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We intend that executive compensation comply with 409A of the Internal Revenue Code, which may impose additional taxes on our NEOs for arrangements that provide for the payment of deferred compensation that is not exempt or in compliance with Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we expense base salaries paid in the year they are earned and annual bonus awarded in cash in the year they are earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with ASC Topic 718, we expense the value of equity awards granted, including those granted as part of annual bonus exchange, over the vesting period of such grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Narrative Discussion to the Summary Compensation Table for Fiscal Year 2016 and the Grants of Plan-Based Awards in Fiscal Year 2016 Table

sentences.text: Equity compensation plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our annual meeting on May 3, 2012, our stockholders approved and adopted the Prologis, Inc. 2012 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the 2012 LTIP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2012 LTIP enables our executive officers, employees, directors and consultants to participate in the ownership of the company and allows us to attract and retain our executive officers, other employees and directors, as well as provide incentives to such persons to maximize our company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we have other equity compensation plans under which equity awards were outstanding as of December 31, 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Amended and Restated 2002 Stock Option and Incentive Plan and the Third Amended and Restated 1997 Stock Option and Incentive Plan, collectively, the AMB Plans, which were both approved by our stockholders; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the ProLogis 2006 Long-Term Incentive Plan, the ProLogis 2000 Share Option Plan for Outside Trustees and the ProLogis 1997 Long-Term Incentive Plan, collectively, the Trust Plans, which were assumed by us under the Merger agreement with all outstanding awards converted based on the Merger exchange ratio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Trust Plans were approved by shareholders of the Trust.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All future equity awards will be granted from the 2012 LTIP, and we will no longer grant any awards from the AMB Plans or the Trust Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The available shares of common stock reserved for issuance under the AMB Plans and the Trust Plans as of May 3, 2012 were added to the share reserve of the 2012 LTIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All outstanding awards under the AMB Plans and the Trust Plans will remain outstanding until they vest, expire or are forfeited by the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, we had 9.9 million shares of common stock remaining available for future issuance under our plans and 9.5 million shares of common stock subject to outstanding unvested awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2012 LTIP does not expire, but no further awards can be granted under the plan after the tenth anniversary date of the plans approval (May 3, 2022).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2012 LTIP does not permit re-pricing of stock options without stockholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants, including non-employee directors, in the 2012 LTIP may receive stock options, stock appreciation rights and full value awards, including dividend equivalents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only employees may receive incentive stock options under the 2012 LTIP, however, we have not granted incentive stock options in the past and currently do not intend to grant any stock options of any kind.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For further detail, please see Equity Compensation Plans below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity award terms
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our annual LTI equity program and PPP, we currently intend to grant LTIP Units and RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock awards were last granted in 2012, and stock options were last granted in 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we provided certain executives with opportunities to earn awards under POP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2014, we offered to certain executives the option to elect to receive LTIP Units in lieu of RSUs that may be granted to them under our compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The general terms of our equity awards outstanding at December 31, 2016 are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each RSU is convertible into one share of common stock upon vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The RSUs generally vest ratably over a continued service period of three years, such that the awards vest 34% after the first year, 33% after the second year and 33% after the third year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs have no voting rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain awards, such as special grants due to hiring or retention considerations, may have different vesting terms, including cliff vesting terms (i.e., the entire award vests on a specified future date).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs granted to NEOs as a part of the bonus exchange generally have a three-year vesting period, such that the bonus exchange awards vest 40% after the first year, 40% after the second year and 20% after the third year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, RSUs earn dividend equivalents (either cash or equity) over the vesting period under the same payment terms as dividends paid on our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs are valued based on the closing price of our common stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTIP Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain participants in the 2012 LTIP can elect to receive LTIP Units instead of RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTIP Units have similar terms to RSUs with respect to vesting provisions, voting rights and dividends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTIP Units are different from POP LTIP Units granted under POP (as discussed below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTIP Units are structured with the intent that the units will generally be economically equivalent to the RSUs that would be issued for the applicable awards and generally have the same vesting terms (three-year vesting) as the RSUs that are granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under certain conditions, an LTIP Unit is convertible into a common unit and then redeemable for one share of our common stock, or at our option, cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other conditions, LTIP Units cannot be converted until they are vested and a waiting period of two years from the date of issuance is complete.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Like RSUs, LTIP Units earn cash distributions equal to the dividend paid on our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After vesting and other conditions are met, LTIP Units remain outstanding until such time as the holder of the LTIP Units elects to convert.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2014, certain executives, including the NEOs, were also given the election to exchange outstanding, unvested RSUs or restricted stock awards (RSAs) into LTIP Units with the same vesting terms as the RSUs or RSAs that were exchanged.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The RSUs and RSAs subject to this exchange were cancelled and LTIP Units were issued pursuant to these exchanges in January 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exchange of the LTIP Units for unvested RSUs and RSAs in January 2015 did not result in incremental fair value for accounting purposes and does not change the total compensation of the NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, the issuance of the LTIP Units in this exchange (and subsequent cancellation of outstanding RSUs and RSAs) does not change the value of the equity awards as presented in the Summary Compensation Table or in the Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For any equity awards granted starting in 2017, including issuances of LTIP Units, Mr. Moghadam has waived any vesting benefits related to meeting retirement-eligibility thresholds under our incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting under such awards will continue after he terminates employment as long as he continues in a substantial role with the company or its affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participation PointsPOP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under POP, certain employees are awarded a portion of a potential compensation pool to be determined based on the number of participation points allocated to them for each performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We made allocations of participation points under POP in 2016 for the 2016-2018 Performance Period, in 2015 for the 2015-2017 Performance Period and in 2014 for the 2014-2016 Performance Period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The participation points are valued using a Monte Carlo simulation as of the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participation points under POP were structured with the intent that the points have no economic value to the participants unless and until performance criteria are met and an award is paid for the applicable performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total compensation pool applicable to about 100 participants in aggregate was initially represented by approximately 10,000 participation points.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actual awards for the performance period, if any, will be determined by multiplying the total compensation pool by a fraction, the numerator of which is the number of participation points held by a participant and the denominator of which is the total number of participation points held by all participants on the last day of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards can be paid in either cash or equity after the end of the three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has determined that the awards will be paid, if at all, in vested common stock or LTIP Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earned POP awards cannot be paid unless and until absolute TSR becomes positive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any earned POP award will expire seven years after the end of the performance period, if absolute TSR does not become positive within that period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each performance period, the Compensation Committee allocated participation points to the NEOs such that 15% of the compensation pool will be paid to Mr. Moghadam and 6% of the compensation pool will be paid to each of the other NEOs if such awards are earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This percentage allocation of the compensation pool will be fixed regardless of the total number of participation points outstanding at the end of the performance period, so that the NEOs will not receive any greater percentage of the compensation pool if participants forfeit their points.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In allocating the percentage of the compensation pools to the NEOs, the Compensation Committee took into consideration external market data concerning the typical ratio of CEO compensation to that of other NEOs and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee generally allocated a smaller portion of the total compensation pool to the NEOs relative to the other participants than is typical in the outperformance plans of other companies the committee reviewed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POP LTIP Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain members of the executive management team, including the NEOs, elected to exchange their POP participation points for special LTIP Units (the POP LTIP Units) as defined under the operating partnership agreement of Prologis, L.P., as amended and/or restated from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The POP LTIP Units are structured with the intent that the units will be comparable economically to the awards under POP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant electing to receive the POP LTIP Units will receive the same percentage of the pool as if the participant had not participated in the exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Like other forms of awards under the plan, the POP LTIP Units will have no economic value to the participants until and unless the performance criteria are achieved at the end of a performance period and other conditions are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once the Compensation Committee determines whether the performance criteria have been met, the POP LTIP Units will be forfeited to the extent not earned based on the terms of POP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an award is earned, an NEO will retain the number of POP LTIP Units equal in economic value to the percentage of the performance pool originally allocated to the NEO at the beginning of the applicable performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any POP LTIP Units in excess of such amount will be forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the satisfaction of certain conditions, including achievement of the relevant performance criteria, each POP LTIP Unit may be convertible into a common unit of the operating partnership and then redeemable for one share of our common stock, or cash at our option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As has become standard tax structuring for profits interests that only vest if performance hurdles are met, the POP LTIP Units are entitled to distributions during the performance period equal to 10% of our common stock dividend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, contrary to most performance-based programs at other REITs, we are requiring participants to make a significant, non-refundable capital contribution for the POP LTIP Units they receive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This feature is intended to make POP LTIP Units comparable economically to POP participation points allocated to applicable participants under the POP, which creates downside risk for participants in the event vesting does not occur because they will then forfeit the capital invested in their POP LTIP Units, and is designed so that participants receive no additional compensation as a result of the exchange of participation points into POP LTIP Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, the issuance of POP LTIP Units in exchange for participation points does not affect the compensation amounts for the NEOs in the Summary Compensation Table or in the Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exchange of the POP LTIP Units for participation points does not result in incremental fair value for accounting purposes and does not change the total compensation of the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the issuance of the POP LTIP Units in exchange for participation points does not change the presentation of the value of the participation points in the Summary Compensation Table or in the Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The POP LTIP Units are included in the Outstanding Equity Awards at Fiscal Year-End table at their threshold value at December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2014-2016 Performance Period: This performance period began on January 1, 2014 and ended on December 31, 2016, including 91 participants at its start.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of the potential compensation pool on February 13, 2014, the date participation points were awarded, was $23.1 million, determined using a Monte Carlo simulation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variables used in the simulation under a risk-neutral premise include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) expected volatility of our common stock of 46%;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) expected volatility of the MSCI REIT Index of 30%; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) correlation between our common stock and the MSCI REIT Index of 89%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The potential compensation pool was capped at $93.5 million, which was 0.5% of our equity market capitalization at December 31, 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, the value of this compensation pool was $62.2 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards for the 2014-2016 performance period were determined by the Compensation Committee on January 17, 2017, resulting in a $9.3 million award paid to Mr. Moghadam and $3.7 million awards paid to each of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2015-2017 Performance Period: This performance period began on January 1, 2015 and will end on December 31, 2017, including 97 participants at its start.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of the potential compensation pool on February 13, 2015, the date participation points were awarded, was $26.5 million, determined using a Monte Carlo simulation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variables used in the simulation under a risk-neutral premise include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) expected volatility of our common stock of 32%;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) expected volatility of the MSCI REIT Index of 24%; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) correlation between our common stock and the MSCI REIT Index of 90%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The potential compensation pool was capped at $109.7 million, which was 0.5% of our equity market capitalization at December 31, 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, the projected value of this compensation pool was $109.7 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016-2018 Performance Period: This performance period began on January 1, 2016 and will end on December 31, 2018, including 110 participants at its start.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of the potential compensation pool on June 3, 2016, the date participation points were awarded, was $26.6 million, determined using a Monte Carlo simulation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variables used in the simulation under a risk-neutral premise include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) expected volatility of our common stock of 23%;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) expected volatility of the MSCI REIT Index of 18%; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) correlation between our common stock and the MSCI REIT Index of 89%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The potential compensation pool was capped at $115.4 million, which was 0.5% of our equity market capitalization at December 31, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, the projected value of this compensation pool was $109.7 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the 2016 amendment of POP, any amounts above $75 million will be paid over the course of three years after the end of the initial three-year performance period only if we continue to perform at or above the MSCI REIT index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POP is also discussed under Compensation Discussion and AnalysisCompensation Elements and Decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participation PointsPPP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under PPP, certain employees receive participation points representing their share of a potential compensation pool that, if funded, will be awarded to the participant in a percentage of equity with any remainder in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The equity portion of the award would be paid in RSUs or LTIP Units with a three-year vesting period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The participation points awarded have no value unless and until an incentive fee or promote is received.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No awards or values are reported as of the date of the allocation of participation points because it is not possible to determine whether any incentive fees or promotes will be received in future years from a particular venture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For accounting purposes, the cash awards will be expensed when earned and paid to participants and the equity awards are expensed over the vesting period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee initially allocated 10,000 participation points to about 100 participants for each applicable venture, representing each ventures PPP award pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each applicable venture, the Compensation Committee allocated 1,500 participation points to Mr. Moghadam and 600 participation points to each of the other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the allocation of PPP participation points to the NEOs, the Compensation Committee utilized a similar rationale as with the awards of participation points made for POP discussed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PPP compensation pools were funded in 2016 and 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No PPP awards were earned in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of a PPP award earned by an NEO is reported as compensation in the year the award is earned by the NEO on the date of determination by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2014, PPP was amended to allow the Compensation Committee to grant awards with the equity percentage over 50% and the remainder in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cash awards earned by the NEOs in 2016 and 2014 under PPP are included as Non-Equity Incentive Plan Compensation in the Summary Compensation Table for Fiscal Year 2016 for the respective year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The equity awards (LTIP Units) are included as Stock Awards in the Summary Compensation Table for Fiscal Year 2016 for the respective year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PPP is discussed in further detail under Compensation Discussion and AnalysisCompensation Elements and 2016 Decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We discontinued the issuance of stock options prior to the Merger in June 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options outstanding are all vested and exercisable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options granted generally vested ratably over a continued service period of three years, however, certain stock options previously granted as a result of the bonus exchange vested over a one-year period (25% per quarter).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options were granted with an exercise price equal to the closing price of our common stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price for any outstanding stock option may not be decreased after the grant date except for reductions approved by our stockholders or if there is an overall adjustment to our outstanding shares, such as an adjustment triggered by a stock split.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options expire on the tenth anniversary of the grant date.
