sentences.text: Funds from Operations attributable to common stockholders and unitholders (FFO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FFO is a non-GAAP financial measure that is commonly used in the real estate industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The most directly comparable GAAP measure to FFO is net earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The National Association of Real Estate Investment Trusts (NAREIT) defines FFO as earnings computed under GAAP to exclude historical cost depreciation and gains and losses from the sales, along with impairment charges, of previously depreciated properties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also consider the gains on revaluation of equity investments upon acquisition of a controlling interest and the gain recognized from a partial sale of our investment, to be similar as a gain from the sale of previously depreciated properties under the NAREIT definition of FFO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We exclude similar adjustments from our unconsolidated entities and the third-parties share of our consolidated ventures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our FFO Measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our FFO measures begin with NAREITs definition and we make certain adjustments to reflect our business and the way that management plans and executes our business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While not infrequent or unusual, the additional items we adjust for in calculating FFO, as modified by Prologis and Core FFO, both as defined below, are subject to significant fluctuations from period to period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although these items may have a material impact on our operations and are reflected in our financial statements, the removal of the effects of these items allows us to better understand the core operating performance of our properties over the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These items have both positive and negative short-term effects on our results of operations in inconsistent and unpredictable directions that are not relevant to our long-term outlook.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appendix A: Definitions and Reconciliations of GAAP and Non-GAAP Financial Measures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We calculate our FFO measures based on our proportionate ownership share of both our unconsolidated and consolidated ventures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reflect our share of our FFO measures for unconsolidated ventures by applying our average ownership percentage for the period to the applicable reconciling items on an entity-by-entity basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reflect our share for consolidated ventures in which we do not own 100% of the equity by adjusting our FFO measures to remove the noncontrolling interests share of the applicable reconciling items based on our average ownership percentage for the applicable periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These FFO measures are used by management as supplemental financial measures of operating performance and we believe that it is important that stockholders, potential investors and financial analysts understand the measures management uses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not use our FFO measures as, nor should they be considered to be, alternatives to net earnings computed under GAAP, as indicators of our operating performance, as alternatives to cash from operating activities computed under GAAP or as indicators of our ability to fund our cash needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We analyze our operating performance primarily by the rental revenues of our real estate and the revenues from our strategic capital business, net of operating, administrative and financing expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This income stream is not directly impacted by fluctuations in the market value of our investments in real estate or debt securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FFO, as modified by Prologis attributable to common stockholders and unitholders (FFO, as modified by Prologis).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To arrive at FFO, as modified by Prologis, we adjust the NAREIT defined FFO measure to exclude:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: deferred income tax benefits and deferred income tax expenses recognized by our subsidiaries
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: current income tax expense related to acquired tax liabilities that were recorded as deferred tax liabilities in an acquisition, to the extent the expense is offset with a deferred income tax benefit in earnings that is excluded from our defined FFO measure;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: unhedged foreign currency exchange gains and losses resulting from debt transactions between us and our foreign consolidated subsidiaries and our foreign unconsolidated entities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: foreign currency exchange gains and losses from the remeasurement (based on current foreign currency exchange rates) of certain third-party debt of our foreign consolidated subsidiaries and our foreign unconsolidated entities; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: mark-to-market adjustments associated with derivative financial instruments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use FFO, as modified by Prologis, so that management, analysts and investors are able to evaluate our performance against other REITs that do not have similar operations or operations in jurisdictions outside the U.S.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Core FFO attributable to common stockholders and unitholders (Core FFO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to FFO, as modified by Prologis, we also use Core FFO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To arrive at Core FFO, we adjust FFO, as modified by Prologis, to exclude the following recurring and nonrecurring items that we recognized directly in FFO, as modified by Prologis:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: gains or losses from contribution or sale of land or development properties that were developed with the intent to contribute or sell;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: income tax expense related to the sale of investments in real estate and third-party acquisition costs related to the acquisition of real estate;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: impairment charges recognized related to our investments in real estate generally as a result of our change in intent to contribute or sell these properties;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: gains or losses from the early extinguishment of debt and redemption and repurchase of preferred stock; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: expenses related to natural disasters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use Core FFO, including by segment and region, to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) assess our operating performance as compared to similar real estate companies and the industry in general,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) evaluate our performance and the performance of our properties in comparison with expected results and results of previous periods, relative to resource allocation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appendix A: Definitions and Reconciliations of GAAP and Non-GAAP Financial Measures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: decisions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) evaluate the performance of our management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) budget and forecast future results to assist in the allocation of resources;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) provide guidance to the financial markets to understand our expected operating performance; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) evaluate how a specific potential investment will impact our future results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limitations on the use of our FFO measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we believe our modified FFO measures are important supplemental measures, neither NAREITs nor our measures of FFO should be used alone because they exclude significant economic components of net earnings computed under GAAP and are, therefore, limited as an analytical tool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, these are only a few of the many measures we use when analyzing our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some of these limitations are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current income tax expenses and acquisition costs that are excluded from our modified FFO measures represent the taxes and transaction costs that are payable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Depreciation and amortization of real estate assets are economic costs that are excluded from FFO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FFO is limited, as it does not reflect the cash requirements that may be necessary for future replacements of the real estate assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, the amortization of capital expenditures and leasing costs necessary to maintain the operating performance of logistics facilities are not reflected in FFO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gains or losses from non-development property acquisitions and dispositions or impairment charges related to expected dispositions represent changes in value of the properties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By excluding these gains and losses, FFO does not capture realized changes in the value of acquired or disposed properties arising from changes in market conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The deferred income tax benefits and expenses that are excluded from our modified FFO measures result from the creation of a deferred income tax asset or liability that may have to be settled at some future point.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our modified FFO measures do not currently reflect any income or expense that may result from such settlement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The foreign currency exchange gains and losses that are excluded from our modified FFO measures are generally recognized based on movements in foreign currency exchange rates through a specific point in time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ultimate settlement of our foreign currency-denominated net assets is indefinite as to timing and amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our FFO measures are limited in that they do not reflect the current period changes in these net assets that result from periodic foreign currency exchange rate movements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The gains and losses on extinguishment of debt that we exclude from our Core FFO may provide a benefit or cost to us as we may be settling our debt at less or more than our future obligation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The natural disaster expenses that we exclude from Core FFO are costs that we have incurred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appendix A: Definitions and Reconciliations of GAAP and Non-GAAP Financial Measures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We compensate for these limitations by using our FFO measures only in conjunction with net earnings computed under GAAP when making our decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This information should be read with our complete Consolidated Financial Statements prepared under GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist investors in compensating for these limitations, we reconcile our modified FFO measures to our net earnings computed under GAAP for years ended December 31 as follows (in millions).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net Operating Income (NOI) is a non-GAAP financial measure used to evaluate our operating performance and represents rental revenue less rental expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net Promote includes actual promotes earned from third-party investors during the period, net of related cash expenses.

sentences.text: Same Store.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We evaluate the operating performance of the operating properties we own and manage using a same store analysis because the population of properties in this analysis is consistent from period to period, thereby eliminating the effects of changes in the composition of the portfolio on performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We include properties from our owned and managed portfolio in our same store analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have defined the same store portfolio, for the three months ended December 31, 2016, as those properties that were in operation at January 1, 2015, and have been in operation throughout the same three-month periods in both 2016 and 2015 (including development properties that have been completed and available for lease).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have removed all properties that were disposed of to a third party or were classified as held for sale to a third party from the population for both periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the factors that affect rental revenues, rental expenses and NOI in the same store portfolio are generally the same as for the total operating portfolio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To derive an appropriate measure of period-to-period operating performance, we remove the effects of foreign currency exchange rate movements by using the recent period end exchange rate to translate from local currency into the U.S. dollar, for both periods
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Same store is a commonly used measure in the real estate industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our same store measures are non-GAAP financial measures that are calculated beginning with rental revenues, rental recoveries and rental expenses from the financial statements prepared in accordance with GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As our same store measures are non-GAAP financial measures, they have certain limitations as analytical tools and may vary among real estate companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, we provide a reconciliation from our financial statements prepared in accordance with GAAP to Same Store Property NOI with explanations of how these metrics are calculated.

sentences.text: Stabilized NOI is equal to the estimated twelve months of potential gross rental revenue (base rent, including above or below market rents plus operating expense reimbursements) multiplied by 95% to adjust income to a stabilized vacancy factor of 5%, minus estimated operating expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Expected Investment (TEI) represents total estimated cost of development or expansion, including land, development and leasing costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TEI is based on current projections and is subject to change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-U.S. dollar investments are translated to U.S. dollars using the exchange rate at period end.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Stockholder Return (TSR) is calculated based on the stock price appreciation and dividends paid to show a total return to a stockholder over a period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This calculation assumes dividends are reinvested into the stock on the day the dividend is paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Value Creation represents the value that we will create through our development and leasing activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We calculate value creation by estimating the Stabilized NOI that the property will generate and applying a stabilized capitalization rate applicable to that property.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value creation is calculated as the amount by which the value exceeds our total expected investment and does not include any fees or promotes we may earn.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Value Creation for our value-added properties that are sold includes the realized economic gain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Weighted Average Annualized Growth Rate is the growth rate of an investment assuming that the investment has been compounding over a period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The growth rate is weighted by using the daily market capitalization of the applicable company averaged over a specified period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Weighted Average Annualized TSR weights the annualized TSR of a company by using the daily market capitalization of the company averaged over the same period of time as the TSR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If applicable, the average daily market capitalization is then converted to USD using the applicable currencys average daily exchange rate over the same period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
